result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mohammad Sharif Karimi in court and by Attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Interpreter appearing via zoom video:  Nahid Murphy.  Reading of Information waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Per Atty. Mayer, case is close to resolution.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 2:30 p.m.

Prosecuting Attorney Stephanie L. Hanson appears via video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video and by Attorney Gillian Parham via video.  COURT REPORTER via Zoom video/audio:  Cheryl Humpal.  Interpreter appears via audio:  Khan Paykar (Persian Interpreter). Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State requests cash bond.
